conclusion: Analyze geometry and apply mechanics to find minimum force at D.
Three ropes of length L connected between points A, B, C, and D. Points A and B are 2L apart on a ceiling. Weight m is suspended from C. CD rope needs to be level.
Horizontal distance between points A and B is 2L.
Each rope is of length L, forming right triangles with horizontal and vertical components.
To keep CD rope level, vertical component of tension in CD must balance weight m.
Vertical component of tension in CD is \( \frac{m \cdot g}{2} \) as weight is divided equally.
Horizontal component of tension in CD must balance tension in AD rope.
Using Pythagorean theorem, horizontal component of tension in CD is \( \frac{m \cdot g}{2} \).
Minimum force at point D is equal to horizontal component of tension in CD, \( \frac{m \cdot g}{2} \).
